thread.title: All you need to know: High school football roundup for Thursday, Oct. 22
thread.title_full: All you need to know: High school football roundup for Thursday, Oct. 22

title: All you need to know: High school football roundup for Thursday, Oct. 22
text:
Published: Friday, Oct. 23 2015 12:20 a.m. MDT Updated: 2 hours ago Lone Peak's Tyler McPherson (2) catches a pass for a touchdown against Herriman in a 5A high school football game in Herriman, UT, Thursday, Oct. 22, 2015. Chris Samuels, Deseret News Box scores 1A North 
DUCHESNE 48, ALTAMONT 0: Duchesne came out swinging and did all of its damage in the first half en route to a convincing blowout road win over Altamont. Lanye Coil rushed for two touchdowns and Tommy Rowley had two interceptions and returned both for touchdowns in the win. Region 2 
DAVIS 35, LAYTON 6: Davis dominated the first and third quarters 28-6 and dismantled Layton's offense to cruise to the home region victory. Kallin Fisher ran all over the Lancers and hit pay dirt twice to fuel the Darts' offensive attack. 
HUNTER 14, SYRACUSE 7: Jerome Fauatea ran all over the visitors as he racked up 188 yards off 34 carries and scored both of Hunter's two touchdowns to help the Wolverines edge Syracuse on the road. 
VIEWMONT 42, GRANGER 26: Cole Huish torched Granger's defense for three passing touchdowns and he ran for another as Viewmont rolled over the Lancers at home. Sione Tauataina ran for over 100 yards and two touchdowns in the loss. Read the game story . Region 3 
BINGHAM 30, BRIGHTON 0: The Miners' Jahvontay Smith had both a rushing and receiving touchdown in the win over the Bengals. Brady Atkin also added two rushing touchdowns of his own to help Bingham easily overcome Brighton. Read the game story . 
JORDAN 55, COTTONWOOD 20: Jordan started off strong in the first half by scoring 48 points. Cottonwood rallied for 13 points in the second half, but it wasn't enough to overcome the deficit as the Beetdiggers won by a wide margin. 
WEST JORDAN 49, COPPER HILLS 13: The Jaguars had a strong showing from their offense in the win over the Grizzles. Julius Rivera had a 55-yard punt return for a touchdown that put the final nail in the coffin for West Jordan. Region 4 
LONE PEAK 30, HERRIMAN 0: Talmage Gunther threw three touchdowns, including two to Jonny Christensen , and ran for another score as Lone Peak shut out Herriman to remain undefeated and lock up the top spot in Region 4. Read the game story . 
PLEASANT GROVE 27, AMERICAN FORK 24: Pleasant Grove ended up winning by a single field goal thanks to Matt Smyth , who kicked three field goals and three extra points in the win. Malik Overstreet also contributed to the win with two receiving touchdowns. Read the game story . 
WESTLAKE 37, LEHI 28: Westlake outscored Lehi 16-0 in the final quarter to secure the come-from-behind home win over Lehi. Saia Taufatofua threw two touchdowns and ran for another to spark the home team's offense in the win. Region 5 
BOUNTIFUL 42, BOX ELDER 28: Thanks to Bountiful's two-touchdown lead established in the first quarter, the Braves were able to hold off the Bees. Box Elder matched its opponents' scoring in the final three quarters, but it wasn't enough to close the gap. Max Tooley ran four two touchdowns while Alan Kieatisinpin had a receiving touchdown and a 90-yard punt return for Bountiful in the win. 
EAST 56, WOODS CROSS 14: The Leopards showed up big time on offense in the win over the Wildcats. Johnnie Lang set the pace for East as he erupted for five rushing touchdowns in the blowout win. 
HIGHLAND 41, BONNEVILLE 35 (3OT): Highland and Bonneville stayed even throughout the game and needed three overtimes to decide a winner. On the last play of the game, the Rams blocked a Lakers' field-goal attempt and returned it to the house for a touchdown to seal the thrilling triple-overtime victory. Non-region 
RIVERTON 32, TAYLORSVILLE 25: After not scoring at all in the first half, Riverton came back and put up 32 points in the second half of the game to complete the come-from-behind win against Taylorsville. Recommended Stories
